posts.title: Light years
posts.excerpt: Quote:LIGHT YEARS is a collage film and a journey through the Swedish landscape, traversing stellar distances in units of 5878 trillion miles. It is a film acutely in the present reflecting our temporal existence … continuous and imperfect. “LIGHT YEARS continues to develop the concerns and techniques begun in her earlier film FRAME LINE. posts.title: Dance Hall
posts.excerpt: A dance trophy winning young couple is temporarily split up when a playboy aviator leads the girl to believe he’s in love with her.

posts.title: Looking for Eric
posts.excerpt: Eric Bishop, a middle-aged postman working for the Manchester sorting office, is going through a dreadful crisis. For starters, his second life companion has not resurfaced although she was released from prison a few months ago. He is left alone with two stepsons to look after, which is no bed of roses since the two …

posts.title: Circe
posts.excerpt: This classic motion picture from Argentina is a 1963 art-house adaptation of a short story by the renowned Argentine writer, Julio Cortázar. The short story of the same name appears in his 1951 collection, Bestiario.In Greek mythology and the Odyssey, Circe is a beautiful and powerful enchantress who uses her gifts to lure men into …

posts._title: Toshio Matsumoto – Ishi no uta AKA The Song of Stone (1963)
posts.title: Ishi no uta
posts.excerpt: While extracting and polishing their blocks of stone, stonecutters used to say the stone is coming to life. This paradox provided Matsumoto with the best metaphor for what making a film is all about. In his opinion, filmmakers work images in the same way that stonecutters work stones.

posts._title: Adilkhan Yerzhanov – Sary mysyq AKA Yellow Cat (2020)
posts.title: Sary mysyq
posts.excerpt: Ex-con Kermek and his beloved Eva want to leave their crime-infested lives on the Kazakh steppes behind. He has a dream: building a movie theater in the mountains.

posts.title: Atman
posts.excerpt: ĀTMAN is a visual tour-de-force based on the idea of the subject at the centre of the circle created by camera positions (480 such positions). Shooting frame-by-frame the filmmaker set up an increasingly rapid circular motion. ĀTMAN is an early Buddhist deity often connected with destruction; the Japanese aspect is stressed by the devil mask …

posts.title: Metastasis – Shinchin taisha
posts.excerpt: Metastasis presents layered projections of a toilet but both the name and the equipment (Matsumoto used an Electro Color Processor a machine commonly used by doctors) convey the ever-present fear of cancer in Japan of that time.

posts._title: Claude Miller – Dites-lui que je l’aime AKA This Sweet Sickness (1977)
posts.title: Dites-lui que je l’aime
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:David is an accountant. He leaves town every Friday, pretending he is going to take care of his parents at their old people’s home. But actually his parents are dead, and he spends the week-ends converting a chalet. He intends to live there with Lise, a woman he knows and loves since childhood. But Lise …

posts._title: Heiner Carow – Bis daß der Tod euch scheidet AKA Until Death Do Us Part (1979)
posts.title: Bis daß der Tod euch scheidet
posts.excerpt: “Bis daß der Tod euch scheidet” is the story of a couple whose mad love for each other smashes headlong into the husband’s patriarchal value system. Based on a true story.
